page.title: 06BISHOPS LYDEARD VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall is in the centre of the village and is also the social centre.The building consists of the Mens Club,a small hall,kitchen and a large hall with a permanent stage.Attached is an open-air swimming pool with changing rooms and toilets,this was given to the village in 1974 by a local farmer.Outside the Hall the younger children have a play area incorporating many types of equipment.Bounded by the Hall and two streams is a large recreation field which is used for a variety of events but mainly as simply a place for old and young to sit or play.The whole complex is governed by a group of elected representatives with the Parish Council as the Custodian Trustees.
